ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Instrument vs. melee attacks
ygData.msgSnippet: ... COF was shorthand for both Chant of Frost and Chant of Flame.  :) ... I added the 48 twice.  So both chants are in there. I should try grouping with
ygData.messageBody:
On Thu, 6 Apr 2000, Sylly Songsynger wrote:
> > FCC = ~31 damage/6 sec
> > CoF = 48 damage/6 sec

'COF' was shorthand for both Chant of Frost and Chant of
Flame. :)

> > total = 127 damage/6 sec = 21.2 damage/sec
> > total w/ MM drum = 148 damage/6 sec = 24.7 damage/sec
> > total w/ Selo's drum = 169 damage/6 sec = 28.2 damage/sec
>
> Hmmm, one chant is missing here? I am guessing you say both CoFl and CoFr
> doing 48 dmg?

I added the 48 twice. So both chants are in there.

I should try grouping with Rokenn and see what we can do
together. CoFr+CoF+FCC w/ Selo's drum = 28.2 damage/sec,
Hymn+Niv's+CoC+CoD w/ Kelin's lute = 16.3 damage/sec and
healing 38 hp(?)/6 sec. Total would be 44.5 damage/sec (equal
to 5 bards meleeing :), healing 6.3 hp/sec.

The resist debuffs from the Chants are nice too. We weren't
taking much damage so I told the cleric to nuke whenever he
saw the "hair stands on end" message. He reported only about
1 in 5 wraths were being resisted, and most were hitting for
full damage, despite most of the seafuries being red to him
(a few were yellow).

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
